text: Actual on-dates and off-dates are dependant on range readiness and when allowable use standards
label: HH3

label: HH2

label: HH2

text: related circumstances.

text: Grazing Management
label: HH2

text: It is strongly suggested that livestock be moved before utilization standards are met.  If allowable
label: HH2

text: use levels are met early in the scheduled pasture, cattle will be rotated into the next pasture or off
label: BODY

text: the Forest This should prevent non-compliance of standards, allowing for time to clean the unit of
label: HH2

label: HH2

text: Cattle are to be completely removed from a pasture by the off date. I will allow you two weeks
label: BODY

text: prior to the off date to begin moving cattle into the next pasture.  If two weeks is not adequate, you
label: BODY

text: must request additional time from this office.  Please notify this office when you begin to move
label: BODY

text: cattle and when a pasture rotation is complete.
label: HH2

text: Permittees with livestock in rested units, grazing units outside the season of use, and grazing areas
label: HH2

text: not authorized in advance, will be non-compliant with the terms and conditions of their Term
label: HH2

text: Grazing Permit.  Appropriate action, including billing at the unauthorized use rate, may be taken.
label: HH2

text: Gila National Forest Management Direction
label: HH2

text: Your Term Grazing Permit includes the specific maximum allowable utilization levels applicable to
label: BODY

text: your allotment.  Allowable use is calculated at a point-in-time.  To comply with standards in the Gila
label: BODY

text: National Forest Plan, livestock must be moved to another unit or remove them from National Forest
label: BODY

text: System lands regardless of the time remaining in the grazing season before utilization standards are met.
label: BODY

text: You are responsible for tracking and complying with your permitted forage use levels.  For your
label: BODY

text: convenience, the South Wahoo C&H Allotment maximum allowable forage utilization levels are listed
label: BODY

text: below:
label: BODY

text: South Wahoo C&H Allotment:
label: HH2

text: The following utilization standards will be applied on the South Wahoo Allotment:
label: BODY

text: • Up to 30% allowable use on all key areas.
label: BODY

text: Range Improvements
label: HH2

text: Range improvements must be maintained to standard before cattle are allowed into a pasture.  It is the
label: BODY

text: permittee’s responsibility to ensure that range improvements remain functional.  This includes boundary
label: BODY

text: fences in pastures not currently being grazed.  Routine maintenance of existing improvements does not
label: BODY

text: require written clearance; however, construction/reconstruction of new improvements must be
label: BODY

text: authorized in writing from this office.
label: BODY

text: 2006 Improvement Planned:
label: BODY

text: • We apologize that we were unable to complete the work on the two dirt tanks that we
label: BODY

text: began last year. At our annual validation meeting we discussed that cleaning out the Bear
label: BODY

text: Tank would be our first priority for grazing year 2006 and we will try and accomplish
label: BODY

text: that work this spring.  Completed ⁭ Not Completed ⁭
label: BODY

text: 2009 Improvements Planned (Work or Supplies Needed from 2006 and New Projects)
label: HH3

text: When improvements have been maintained, please call the Black Range Ranger Station and
label: HH2

text: report that maintenance has been completed.  If verification is not received from the permittee,
label: HH2

text: inspections will be made.  During that inspection, if we find maintenance has not been completed,
label: HH3

text: and livestock are grazing an area unscheduled for use at the time, they will be considered
label: HH2

text: unauthorized.  Permittees may be billed for unauthorized use and/or permit action taken for
label: HH2

text: maintenance.
label: HH2

text: All water developments must provide access and escape to and from water for all types of wildlife.
label: BODY

text: Please contact the Kameron or Shane for assistance.
label: BODY

text: 1. Monitoring
label: HH3

text: Key areas for monitoring are identified as riparian areas and transect cluster locations.  Additional key
label: BODY

text: areas may be identified during the season based on routine monitoring.
label: BODY

text: The idea of a key area is to find a site that is representative of a larger area in which cattle obtain the
label: BODY

text: majority of their required forage resources.  Key area monitoring will avoid areas directly adjacent to
label: BODY

text: permanent water sources, cattle trails, roads, and fence lines.
label: BODY

text: Upland areas will be monitored for use on perennial grass species.
label: BODY

text: District personnel will contact the permittees to coordinate site visits to monitor key areas.  Permittee
label: BODY

text: participation is encouraged.  Forage utilization estimates will be consistent with the Forest Service
label: BODY

text: Range Analysis Handbook methodology, and may also include FS Regional stubble-height standards, as
label: BODY

text: well as other techniques generally accepted in the field of range management.
label: BODY

text: 2. Special Management Instructions
label: HH3

text: he following restrictions will be implemented so that management remains in compliance with the
label: BODY

text: Endangered Species Act.  The instructions below relate to threatened, endangered, and proposed to be
label: BODY

text: listed species as well as range/watershed conditions.
label: BODY

text: • There are no documentations that identify any protected and restricted Mexican Spotted Owl
label: BODY

text: habitat on the South Wahoo Allotment, therefore there are no restrictions regarding the Mexican
label: BODY

text: Spotted Owl.
label: BODY

text: • Stock tanks must be surveyed for possible aquatic habitat before earth-disturbing maintenance is
label: BODY

text: authorized.
label: BODY

text: • The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service listed the Chiricahua leopard frog as a threatened species in
label: BODY

text: 2002. We have completed grazing consultation on your allotment regarding the effects of
label: BODY

text: livestock grazing on the Chiricahua leopard frog. We determined that livestock grazing will
label: BODY

text: either have no effect or will not adversely affect the Chiricahua leopard frog. As a result of this
label: BODY

text: determination, there were no changes required of your grazing permit. The U.S. Fish and
label: BODY

text: Wildlife Service concurred with this determination. Therefore, consultation has been completed.
label: BODY

text: A copy of this consultation is on file with your local Ranger District.
label: BODY

text: The Endangered Species Act requires that actions funded or carried out by the federal government go
label: BODY

text: through the consultation process to insure these actions do not jeopardize the continued existence of a
label: BODY

text: listed species. Please notify this office of any planned earth disturbing activities involving riparian
label: BODY

text: areas, dirt tanks, or other sources of open water.
label: BODY

text: 3. Other Instructions
label: HH3

text: On yearlong ranges, calves under six months of age on January 1st will be counted against the
label: BODY

text: authorized numbers.  By April 1st, these calves must be removed from the Forest or counted
label: HH2

text: against the authorized numbers.
label: HH2

text: The permittee must obtain permission from this office, before conducting earth- disturbing activities on
label: BODY

text: the National Forest.  The Forest Service will arrange inspections of project areas and will prepare
label: BODY

text: appropriate environmental and cultural documents before earth-disturbing activities proceed.  These
label: BODY

text: activities include road/earthen tank maintenance, as well as construction/reconstruction of trails, roads,
label: BODY

text: earthen tanks, etc.  Do not conduct any earth-disturbing activities using heavy equipment on the Forest
label: BODY

text: without written clearance from this office.
label: BODY

text: Salt must be located at least ¼ mile from water, and preferably on ridges and/or areas of low use.  Do
label: BODY

text: not place salt blocks in the same location as the previous year, and locate blocks on hard ground not
label: BODY

text: susceptible to erosion. Supplemental feeding, other than mineral or supplement block, is not authorized
label: BODY

text: on the National Forest.
label: BODY

text: Accurate records of your operation will aid in planning and determining the effectiveness of the grazing
label: BODY

text: system.  Please maintain reasonably accurate records of cattle numbers throughout the grazing season.
label: BODY

text: The Annual Operating Instructions are a part of the Term Grazing Permit as provided for in Part 1,
label: BODY

text: Section 3.  These instructions comply with the standards and guidelines found in the Forest Plan,
label: BODY

text: including the 1996 Forest Plan Amendment.  They also comply with the Endangered Species Act found
label: BODY

text: in the Biological Assessment for the South Wahoo Allotment.  Any additional information collected
label: BODY

text: during the year may be incorporated into the Annual Operating Instructions.
label: BODY

text: These instructions are not subject to administrative review, pursuant to 36 CFR 251.
label: BODY

text: Your compliance with these instructions is essential for the proper management of National Forest
label: BODY

text: System lands.  Failure to comply with the terms and conditions of your permit and these instructions
label: BODY

text: may result in issuance of a notice of noncompliance with the terms of your grazing permit.  If needed
label: BODY

text: during the grazing season, changes can be made in these instructions, provided the changes are first
label: BODY

text: approved and documented by the District Ranger or other authorized Forest Service officer.
label: BODY

text: We look forward to working with you and solicit your cooperation and involvement in bringing about
label: BODY

text: sound range and livestock management practices that will enhance all of the allotment's resources.  If
label: BODY

text: you have any ideas or suggestions that will improve the management of this allotment, we would like to
label: BODY

text: hear from you.
label: BODY

text: This 2009 Annual Operating Provisions for the South Wahoo C&H Allotment was discussed with
label: HH3

label: BODY

text: of your term grazing permit.  As such, they require the same degree of compliance as the regular terms
label: BODY

text: of your permit.
